page.title: 07BRENTFORD HIGH STREET
page.content:
The main street runs between an old area of late Victorian housing to the North and industry to the South.The High Street is dominated by the Magistrate's Court which reflects Brentford's function as a county town.
There are numerous public houses, including the Beehive, which has a model of a beehive on its roof.
The largest shops are Goddard's (furniture and romoval) and the newly built International supermarket.
The other shops are smaller and are mainly food shops. There are several which have recently closed and are for sale.
